titleStmt.title: James M. Coulter to Beriah Magoffin
CWG2793

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Civil Appointments, 1859-1862

body.p:
Mayfield Ky. April 23 1862.
Beriah Magoffin
Gov. Kentucky.
Dr Sir.

On the 5th Inst. the Justices of the Peace for this -- Graves. County. being convened by my summons elected W. G. Blount Esq to the Office of County Judge -- to fill the Vacancy occasioned by the resignation of W. W. Robertson Esq. resigned -- & of record in my office. And immediately I forwarded to Secty of State. a certificate of his election -- and a copy of order noting the resignation of Judge Robertson, and up to this date nothing has been heard from same -- no Commission has come to Esqr Blount. and we do greatly need a County Judge. and hope you will forthwith ford his comn If the Cert &c have miscarried ford Comn any how & cetfd Copies of same shall be forthwith sent to you. Many cases of administration etc need attention and nothing can be done until we have a county Judge.

Yours Most Respectfully
Jas. M. Coulter
Clk. Gr. Co. Ct

Graves Co
Pr. Judge
W. G. Blount
Com Issd May 1. 1862
